title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development 

(Fees for Certain Applications) Regulations 2024. 

(2) The collective citation “Planning and Development Regulations 2001 

to 2024” includes these Regulations. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited planning development (fees certain applications) regulation 2024 (2) collective citation planning development regulation 2001 2024 includes regulation interpretation

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)), hereby
heading: In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Planning and
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Planning and 

Development Regulations, 2001 (S.I. No. 600 of 2001). 

Fees for Maritime Planning applications
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean planning development regulation 2001 (s.i no 600 2001) fee maritime planning application

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 3. The following article is inserted after article 172 of the Principal
text_raw:
3. The following article is inserted after article 172 of the Principal 

Regulations 

“Fees for maritime planning applications” 

172A. The fee payable in respect of maritime planning applications. 

(1) Fees payable to the Board in respect of 

i. 

Consultations prior to application for permission under 
section 287 of the Act, 

ii. Application under section 291 of the Act for proposed 
development in Maritime Area that comes within the 
Eighth Schedule, 

iii. Application under section 291 of the Act for Maritime 
Area Development not listed in the Eighth Schedule, 

iv. Requests, under section 297 of the Act for alterations to 

permissions granted, and 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 21st May, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [226] 3 

v. 

The making of submissions and observations in 
accordance with section 291 or 292 

are set out in Section 4 of Schedule 9, Scale of Fees for Maritime Planning 
Applications. 

(2) Paragraph (v) of sub-article (1) shall not apply where the person 
or body by whom a submission or observation is made is - 

i. 

ii. 

iii. 

iv. 

v. 

vi. 

vii. 

viii. 

ix. 

x. 

xi. 

xii. 

xiii. 

xiv. 

xv. 

xvi. 

xvii. 

xviii. 

xix. 

xx. 

xxi. 

xxii. 

xxiii. 

The Minister; 

the Minister 
Communications; 

for 

the Environment, Climate and 

the Minister for Transport; 

the Minister for Defence; 

the Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine; 

the Environmental Protection Agency; 

the Maritime Area Regulatory Authority; 

the Minister for Rural and Community Development; 

Marine Institute; 

Inland Fisheries Ireland; 

Health and Safety Authority; 

Commission for Regulation of Utilities; 

Fáilte Ireland, where the development might obstruct or 
detract from any tourist amenity; 

An Taisce; 

a local authority, where the area of the local authority might 
be affected by the development; 

a relevant regional assembly; 

National Transport Authority; 

Irish Aviation Authority, where the development might 
endanger or interfere with the safety of, or the safe and 
efficient operation of, aircraft; 

Sustainable Energy Authority of Ireland; 

Eirgrid; 

Commissioner of Irish Lights; 

Irish Coastguard; 

if any transboundary considerations apply, the Northern 
Ireland Department for Regional Development, the Loughs 
Agency and the Minister for Foreign Affairs. 

 
 
 4 [226]

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 4. The following section is inserted after Section 3 of Schedule 9 of the
text_raw:
4. The following section is inserted after Section 3 of Schedule 9 of the 

Principal Regulations 

“Section 4” 

Scale of Fees for Maritime Planning Applications 

Class of Consultation, Application, request or 
Submission. 

S.287 - Consultation with Board prior to 
application for permission 

S.291 Application for proposed development in 
Maritime Area that comes within the Eighth 
Schedule. 

S.291 Applications for Maritime Area 
Development not listed in the Eighth Schedule 

Fee Amount 

€1500 

€100,000 

€10,000 

S.297 Requests for alterations to permissions 
granted 

50% of relevant application fee up to a 
maximum of €30K 

The making of submissions and observations in 
accordance with section 291 or 292 

€50 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

17 May, 2024. 

DARRAGH O’ BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage.
